geometry.planar

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Direction>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigIntDirection, IntDirection

    public abstract class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Direction>, java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class defining functionality of directions in the plane. A Direction is an equivalence class of vectors. Two vectors define the same object of class Direction, if they point into the same direction. We prefer using directions instead of angles, because with angles the arithmetic calculations are in general not exact.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double angle_approx()
      Returns an approximation of the signed angle corresponding to this dierection.
      int compare_from(Direction p_1, Direction p_2)
      Returns 1, if the angle between p_1 and this direction is bigger the angle between p_2 and this direction, 0, if p_1 is equal to p_2, * and -1 otherwise.
      boolean equals(Direction p_other)
      Returns true, if p_ob is a Direction and this Direction and p_ob point into the same direction
      static Direction get_instance_approx(double p_angle)
      Creates a Direction whose angle with the x-axis is nearly equal to p_angle
      static Direction get_instance(Point p_from, Point p_to)
      Calculates the direction from p_from to p_to.
      static Direction get_instance(Vector p_vector)
      creates a Direction from the input Vector
      abstract Vector get_vector()
      return any Vector pointing into this direction
      abstract boolean is_diagonal()
      returns true, if the direction is diagonal
      boolean is_multiple_of_45_degree()
      returns true, if the direction is orthogonal or diagonal
      abstract boolean is_orthogonal()
      returns true, if the direction is horizontal or vertical
      Direction middle_approx(Direction p_other)
      calculates an approximation of the direction in the middle of this direction and p_other
      abstract Direction opposite()
      returns the opposite direction of this direction
      Signum projection(Direction p_other)
      The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of of a vector representing this direction and a vector representing p_other is > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.
      Side side_of(Direction p_other)
      Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other.get_vector().
      abstract Direction turn_45_degree(int p_factor)
      turns the direction by p_factor times 45 degree

      • get_instance

        public static Direction get_instance(Point p_from,
                                     Point p_to)
        Calculates the direction from p_from to p_to. If p_from and p_to are equal, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        p_from - a Point object.
        p_to - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a Direction object.

        Returns:
        a Direction object.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(Direction p_other)
        Returns true, if p_ob is a Direction and this Direction and p_ob point into the same direction
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Direction object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(Direction p_other)
        Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other.get_vector(). The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this.get_vector() is on the left of L Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this.get_vector() is on the right of L and Side.COLLINEAR, if this.get_vector() is collinear with L.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Direction object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • projection

        public Signum projection(Direction p_other)
        The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of of a vector representing this direction and a vector representing p_other is > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Direction object.
        Returns:
        a Signum object.

      • middle_approx

        public Direction middle_approx(Direction p_other)

        Returns:
        a Direction object.

        Parameters:
        p_1 - a Direction object.
        p_2 - a Direction object.
        Returns:
        a int.
